channel.title: What kind of sound packs would you like to see in the future?
channel.description: Let us know what you wish for! It's quite complicated to make a sound pack though so don't expect us to just drop the pack you're wishing for next week. It's especially tricky to make packs with well-known producers, since most people you know of are super busy and not even possible to get a hold of. We're trying out best though.

item.title: What kind of sound packs would you like to see in the future?
item.dc:creator: Davis9754
item.description:
make sure more sounds have different types of distortions and different values for distortion, delay, and reverb as a default. all new sounds have very similar, if not the same effect settings by default

Read full topic

item.title: What kind of sound packs would you like to see in the future?
item.dc:creator: ThoughtfulNoise
item.description:
Vintage Keys 2 (with proper phaser and vibrato controls)
— more Rhodes, with character (ref:`J3PO’s preset pack for Addictive Keys Mark One)

Retro analog leads (with proper Decay controls — and a bloomin’ mono option)
— bunch of Moog stuff would be great

Pianos 2
— incl. Felt pianos, prepared pianos, …

—

No more sound fx, glitches, drums or percussion. Those things are easy to source elsewhere - and the kit library is already unmanageably large.

Oh, and definitely no more bottom-of-the-barrel packs “from Mars” (especially when the better sounds aren’t included).

The ‘from Mars’ offerings actually include some quality retro synth samples. Shame Auxy will only license miserly sub-selections from the absolute cheapest stuff.

Read full topic
item.source: What kind of sound packs would you like to see in the future?

item.title: What kind of sound packs would you like to see in the future?
item.dc:creator: KJCannon101
item.description:
I assume you mean heavy metal guitars, in that case I strongly agree. Dedicated metal/electric/rock guitars would be a great addition in my opinion and has been requested multiple times. I’m not sure about a Lofi drum kit as we already have a few kits/packs that will do the job very easily, namely most of the Mars kits/packs.

Read full topic

item.source: What kind of sound packs would you like to see in the future?

item.title: What kind of sound packs would you like to see in the future?
item.dc:creator: ThoughtfulNoise
item.description:
I’m inclined to disagree there.
Those packs refer to sounds that exist out there in the wild, and are often more widely known than Auxy.

People will most likely want to look for them and find them by name, so renaming them to something bespoke just makes them harder to find — and actually reduces the appeal of Auxy and/or the pack bc ppl may not realise they’re available.

After all, you wouldn’t rename a saxophone instrument to something completely unrelated, would you?

Read full topic
item.source: What kind of sound packs would you like to see in the future?

item.title: What kind of sound packs would you like to see in the future?
item.dc:creator: Davis9754
item.description:
and another thing: i want new drum kits to be named in the same way as melodic instruments, like with nouns, adjectives, etc. rather than the names of the sound packs they came from because it feels boring imo. for example, a drum kit from SDS800 from mars shouldn’t be called SDS800, but maybe a noun

Read full topic
item.source: What kind of sound packs would you like to see in the future?

item.title: What kind of sound packs would you like to see in the future?
item.dc:creator: ThoughtfulNoise
item.description:
Importing is an ok option, but usually means a limited octave range for the usable notes. Go too high or too low and things quickly start to chipmunks or dragged.

It can help when bringing in sounds that Auxy will likely never be able create, but I t’s not really a scalable alternative to properly created sounds based on the internal synth engine.

Read full topic
item.source: What kind of sound packs would you like to see in the future?
